description: Hardhat CLI for development and testing.

subcommands.name: hardhat check
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] check

check: Check whatever you need

For global options help run: hardhat help

subcommands.name: hardhat clean
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] clean [--global]

OPTIONS:

  --global	Clear the global cache 

clean: Clears the cache and deletes all artifacts

For global options help run: hardhat help
subcommands.description: Clears the cache and deletes all artifacts

options.description: Makes the compilation process less verbose

subcommands.name: hardhat compile
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] compile [--force] [--quiet]

OPTIONS:

  --force	Force compilation ignoring cache 
  --quiet	Makes the compilation process less verbose 

compile: Compiles the entire project, building all artifacts

For global options help run: hardhat help
subcommands.description: Compiles the entire project, building all artifacts

options.description: Don't compile before running this task

subcommands.name: hardhat console
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] console [--no-compile]

OPTIONS:

  --no-compile	Don't compile before running this task 

console: Opens a hardhat console

For global options help run: hardhat help

subcommands.name: hardhat flatten
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] flatten ...files

POSITIONAL ARGUMENTS:

  files	The files to flatten 

flatten: Flattens and prints contracts and their dependencies

For global options help run: hardhat help
subcommands.description: Flattens and prints contracts and their dependencies

options.description: The URL of the JSON-RPC server to fork from
The block number to fork from
The host to which to bind to for new connections (Defaults to 127.0.0.1 running locally, and 0.0.0.0 in Docker)
The port on which to listen for new connections

subcommands.name: hardhat node
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] node --fork <STRING> --fork-block-number <INT> --hostname <STRING> [--port <INT>]

OPTIONS:

  --fork             	The URL of the JSON-RPC server to fork from 
  --fork-block-number	The block number to fork from 
  --hostname         	The host to which to bind to for new connections (Defaults to 127.0.0.1 running locally, and 0.0.0.0 in Docker) 
  --port             	The port on which to listen for new connections (default: 8545)

node: Starts a JSON-RPC server on top of Hardhat Network

For global options help run: hardhat help
subcommands.description: Starts a JSON-RPC server on top of Hardhat Network

options.description: Don't compile before running this task

subcommands.name: hardhat run
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] run [--no-compile] script

OPTIONS:

  --no-compile	Don't compile before running this task 

POSITIONAL ARGUMENTS:

  script	A js file to be run within hardhat's environment 

run: Runs a user-defined script after compiling the project

For global options help run: hardhat help
subcommands.description: Runs a user-defined script after compiling the project

options.description: Don't compile before running this task

subcommands.name: hardhat test
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] test [--no-compile] [...testFiles]

OPTIONS:

  --no-compile	Don't compile before running this task 

POSITIONAL ARGUMENTS:

  testFiles	An optional list of files to test (default: [])

test: Runs mocha tests

For global options help run: hardhat help

options.description: Shows this message, or a task's help if its name is provided
The maximum amount of memory that Hardhat can use.
Reserved hardhat argument -- Has no effect.

name: hardhat
raw_help_text:
Hardhat version 2.1.2

Usage: hardhat [GLOBAL OPTIONS] <TASK> [TASK OPTIONS]

GLOBAL OPTIONS:

  --config           	A Hardhat config file. 
  --emoji            	Use emoji in messages. 
  --help             	Shows this message, or a task's help if its name is provided 
  --max-memory       	The maximum amount of memory that Hardhat can use. 
  --network          	The network to connect to. 
  --show-stack-traces	Show stack traces. 
  --tsconfig         	Reserved hardhat argument -- Has no effect. 
  --verbose          	Enables Hardhat verbose logging 
  --version          	Shows hardhat's version. 


AVAILABLE TASKS:

  check  	Check whatever you need
  clean  	Clears the cache and deletes all artifacts
  compile	Compiles the entire project, building all artifacts
  console	Opens a hardhat console
  flatten	Flattens and prints contracts and their dependencies
  help   	Prints this message
  node   	Starts a JSON-RPC server on top of Hardhat Network
  run    	Runs a user-defined script after compiling the project
  test   	Runs mocha tests

To get help for a specific task run: npx hardhat help [task]
